title-group.article-title: Role of Piston Bowl Shape to Enhance Late-Cycle Soot Oxidation in Low-Swirl Diesel Combustion

abstract.p: Late-cycle soot oxidation in heavy-duty (HD) diesel engine low-swirl combustion was investigated using single-cylinder engine and spray chamber experiments together with engine combustion simulations. The in-cylinder flow during interactions between adjacent flames (flame-flame events) was shown to have a large impact on late-cycle combustion. To modify the flame-flame, a new piston bowl shape with a protrusion (wave) was designed to guide the near-wall flow. This design significantly reduced soot emissions and increased engine thermodynamic efficiency. The wave’s main effect was to enhance late-cycle mixing, as demonstrated by apparent rate of heat release after the termination of fuel injection. Combustion simulations showed that the increased mixing is driven by enhanced flow re-circulation, which produces a radial mixing zone (RMZ). The leading edge of the RMZ extends toward the center of the piston bowl, where unused ambient gas is available, promoting oxidation. The wave also enhances mixing in the trailing edge of the RMZ when it detaches from the wall, accelerating the burn-out of the RMZ. This flame interaction effect was isolated and studied further using a new optical setup in a spray chamber with a 2-hole nozzle fuel injector. A conceptual model relating piston bowl geometry to soot oxidation efficiency was developed to explain late-cycle soot oxidation in low-swirl HD engines.

The O₂ field in the plane containing the two spray axes. The figure illustrates the formation of an RMZ during the 20 CAD period starting with the onset of the flame-flame event at 370 CAD. Red, blue/green, and yellow regions in the plots represent areas of pure ambient gas, rich mixtures, and stoichiometric mixtures, respectively. © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved

Evolution of the fuel distribution (quantified in terms of the mixture fraction Z) in a double-sector simulation of rich pocket oxidation (i.e., the time between EOI+10 and EOI+60). Blue and red/green regions indicate volumes containing pure ambient gas and rich mixtures, respectively. The textured iso-surface shows where the mixture is stoichiometric. © 2019 SAE International. Illustration of the coupling between initiation of the rich pocket oxidation phase and the change in the slope of the aRoHR curve at 390 CA. The change in slope is indicated with a green circle. The plotted results originate from CFD simulations of combustion at full load. © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved

Results from the spray chamber setup with a two-hole nozzle (A) and the wave piston sector (profile B, see Figure 3d). Fuel injection with Prail = 1000 bar and 1 ms injection duration. The figure shows a time-series of instantaneous natural flame luminosity images acquired between 3.33 and 4.66 ms after EOI along the symmetry axis between the two sprays (C). The green dot and yellow arrows indicate the nozzle location and original spray axes, respectively. The letters D, E, F, and G indicate the RMZ, its leading and trailing edges, and an adjacent RMZ, respectively. Frame rate: 75000 frames per s (interval 13.31 ms). © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved

Results from the spray chamber setup with a two-hole nozzle and 2D open wall setup. Fuel injection with Prail = 1000 bar and 1 ms injection duration. Mean OH chemilumiscence time series from 10 replicates. Upper row: conventional reference bowl (see Figure 3a); lower row: Wave piston shape (see Figure 3b). False color scale 0-255 relative light intensity. © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved
Schematic of late-cycle mixing in low-swirl combustion. Left: conventional bowl; right: wave bowl. © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved

A typical high-load aRoHR curve with labels highlighting points corresponding to key events. Blue and green colors indicate events discussed in the introduction and events discussed in this article, respectively. © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved

SC results. Natural luminosity (false color scheme) showing a detached U-shaped RMZ above a wave-shaped protrusion. Dotted red line is the symmetry line. Blue dotted line is main jet trajectory. Injection pressure (500 bar). © 2019 SAE International. All Rights Reserved
